messages.author: jam
messages.text: you use pid for service processes, while for renderers you're using process_id (which is not a pid, but rather a unique id). the reason we avoid using pids is that they get recycled, which can cause some hard to catch bugs. Can you make each ServiceutilityProcessHost generate a unique id using ChildProcessInfo::GenerateChildProcessUniqueId, and pass that to the font caching code

messages.author: arthurhsu
messages.text:
On 2011/09/15 16:18:23, John Abd-El-Malek wrote:
> you use pid for service processes, while for renderers you're using process_id
> (which is not a pid, but rather a unique id). the reason we avoid using pids is
> that they get recycled, which can cause some hard to catch bugs. Can you make
> each ServiceutilityProcessHost generate a unique id using
> ChildProcessInfo::GenerateChildProcessUniqueId, and pass that to the font
> caching code

Done.

messages.author: jam
messages.text: instead of declaring this message for utility/renderer, it should be in child_process_messages.h. and while you're at it, please move ViewHostMsg_PreCacheFont as well and ChromeUtilityHostMsg_PreCacheFont

messages.author: arthurhsu
messages.text:

> instead of declaring this message for utility/renderer, it should be in
